intro: Alkanna milliana, commonly known as the Mexican bloodroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red-orange sap. The plant produces showy white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate and have a lobed shape, while its roots are thick and fleshy. Alkanna milliana is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
